question_description: On Passage of the Bill: H.R. 8, As Amended; An act entitled the "American Taxpayer Relief Act of 2012".
On the Nomination: Confirmation Carol J. Galante, of California, to be an Assistant Seceretary of Housing and Urban Development
On the Nomination: Confirmation William Joseph Baer, of Maryland, to be an Assistant Attorney General
On Passage of the Bill: H.R. 1 as Amended; An act making appropriations for disaster relief for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2013, and for other purposes.
On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3391: Coats Amdt. No. 3391; In the nature of a substitute.

On the Motion S.Amdt. 3367: Motion to Waive All Applicable Budgetary Discipline Re: Merkley Amdt. No. 3367, as Modified Further; To extend certain supplemental agriculture disaster assistance programs.
On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3355: McCain Amdt. No. 3355; To strike funding for the emergency forest restoration program.
On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3410: Paul Amdt. No. 3410; To offset the cost of the bill and to put the spending on budget as regular spending and not emergency.
On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3376: Paul Amdt. No. 3376; To provide for the nonapplication of the Davis-Bacon Act in the case of projects funded under this Act.
On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3382: Coburn Amdt. No. 3382; To require merit-based and competitive awards of disaster recovery contracts.
On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3371: Coburn Amdt. No. 3371; To ensure that Federal disaster assistance is available for the most severe disasters, and for other purposes.

On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3370: Coburn Amdt. No. 3370, Div II; To ensure funding for victims of Hurricane Sandy is not spent on tax cheats, deceased individuals, or fisheries outside of the affected area.
On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3368: Coburn Amdt. No. 3368; To clarify cost-sharing requirements for certain Corps of Engineers activities.
On the Motion S.Amdt. 3350: Motion to Waive All Applicable Budgetary Discipline Re: Tester Amdt. No. 3350; To provide additional funds for wildland fire management.
On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3344: Bingaman Amdt. No. 3344; To provide for the approval of an agreement between the United States and the Republic of Palau in response to Super Typhoon Bopha.
On Passage of the Bill: H.R. 5949; A bill to extend the FISA Amendments Act of 2008 for five years.
On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3439: Wyden Amdt. No. 3439; To require a report on the impact of the FISA Amendments Act of 2008 on the privacy of the people of the United States.
On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3436: Paul Amdt. No. 3436; To ensure adequate protection of the rights under the Fourth Amendment to the Constitution of the United States.

On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3435: Merkley Amdt. No. 3435; To require the Attorney General to disclose each decision, order, or opinion of a Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court that includes significant legal interpretation of section 501 or 702 of the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978 unless such disclosure is not in the national security interest of the United States.
On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3437: Leahy Amdt. No. 3437; In the nature of a substitute.

On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3262: McCain Amdt. No. 3262, As Modified; To require a report on military activities to deny or significantly degrade the use of air power against civilian and opposition groups in Syria.

On the Amendment S.Amdt. 2104: Toomey Amdt. No. 2104; To prohibit an increase in the lending authority of the Export-Import Bank of the United States to more than $100,000,000,000 until the Secretary of the Treasury certifies that the Secretary has initiated international negotiations to eliminate export financing programs and to prohibit an increase in that lending authority to more than $120,000,000,000 until a multilateral agreement to eliminate export financing programs has been completed.

On the Amendment S.Amdt. 2103: Vitter Amdt. No. 2103; To clarify the requirement that the Export-Import Bank of the United States not make or guarantee loans that are subordinate to other loans, to restrict financing of certain fossil fuel projects in foreign countries, and to prohibit financing of renewable energy products manufactured in foreign countries.

On the Amendment S.Amdt. 2102: Corker Amdt. No. 2102; To require the Export-Import Bank of the United States to provide financing only for transactions subsidized by export credit agencies of other countries or for which private sector financing is unavailable or prohibitively expensive and to require the Bank to maintain a ratio of capital to the outstanding principal balance of loans and loan guarantees of not less than 10 percent.

On the Amendment S.Amdt. 2101: Paul Amdt. No. 2101; To prohibit the Export-Import Bank of the United States from providing financing to a person or for a project in a country the government or central bank of which holds debt instruments of the United States.

On the Amendment S.Amdt. 2100: Lee Amdt. No. 2100; To phase out the authority of the Export-Import Bank of the United States and to require the President to initiate negotiations with other major exporting countries to end subsidized export financing programs.
